main event: A military report from Guam on 8th June 1949 described the sighting of a flying white, billowing substance resembling a traveling contrail, moving from east-northeast to west-southwest at an estimated speed of 1200 mph.
interesting points: The observation was made from an Air KB29 at an altitude of 14,500 feet, and the object was seen at a distance of approximately 30 miles.
The traveling contrail dissipated almost as soon as it was formed, and the color of the substance was described as white.
The sighting lasted approximately 1 minute, and the weather conditions were reported as excellent.
The report mentions triangulation being used to estimate the speed of the object at 1200 mph, indicating a sophisticated approach to analysis.
The document also includes bureaucratic processing details such as transmittal forms, control numbers, and hand receipts, reflecting the official handling of the report.
sighted object: white, billowing substance resembling a traveling contrail
witnesses: Military personnel - an Air KB29 crew
